DOCNAME: CASE OF ASSOCIATION OF CITIZENS RADKO AND PAUNKOVSKI v. "THE FORMER YUGOSLAV REPUBLIC OF MACEDONIA"
JUDGES: Isabelle Berro-Lefèvre;Karel Jungwiert;Mark Villiger;Mirjana Lazarova Trajkovska;Peer Lorenzen;Rait Maruste;Renate Jaeger
TEXT: CARDINAL . The second applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE , the former GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE CARDINAL NORP nationals , including the second applicant , founded ORG in the city of ORG . On DATE ORG registered the ORG in the register of associations of citizens and foundations under the following name : “ ORG PERSON ” .

CARDINAL . LAW ( “ the NORP ” ) defined the ORG as an independent , non - political and public organisation , which studies and promotes ORG ( “ the Movement ” ) through commonly accepted democratic principles and standards .
CARDINAL . LAW defined its objectives and tasks as follows :
“ The ORG has the following objectives and tasks :
it endeavours to raise and affirm the NORP cultural space ;
it endeavours to establish traditional ethical and human values ;

it endeavours to popularise the objectives , tasks and ideas of ORG through the publication of its own newspaper , publishing activity and library , and through its own electronic media , seminars , conferences , forums and other forms of cultural action . ”
CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL set out that the ORG will attain these objectives and tasks through :
“ - the individual and collective activities of the members , bodies and structures of the ORG ,
- cooperation between the ORG and other similar associations and structures , inside the country and abroad ” .
CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL provided that every citizen who accepted the ORG ’s Programme could become a member .
CARDINAL . LAW provided :
“ Every citizen of GPE and citizens of a foreign state may become a member , if they have reached DATE , after signing a membership application ” .
CARDINAL . The ORG ’s Programme of CARDINAL DATE consisted of CARDINAL paragraphs . It read as follows :

“ The ORG is founded as a non - governmental , non - party and non - political organisation with the purpose of raising and affirming the NORP cultural space , establishing traditional ethical and human values , affirmed in the ideas of ORG , through the publication of its own newspaper , publishing activity and library , and through its own electronic media , seminars , conferences , forums and other forms of cultural action .

For the above objectives , the ORG will organise public forums , with the participation of outstanding cultural and scientific scholars from inside the country and abroad , through its local committees . ”

CARDINAL . On DATE the official launch of the ORG took place in a hotel in GPE , the capital of the former GPE . A promotional leaflet by the ORG ( which accompanied the letters of invitation for the opening ceremony ) was published at DATE . It provided information about the ORG ’s name , objectives and the ways in which these were to be achieved . It read :
“ a. Name of the Association
The founders of the ORG have taken as its name the most frequently used pseudonym of PERSON , PERSON .

PERSON , his name , his life , his revolutionary activity and especially his cultural and literary activity are deeply woven in the history of GPE . Praised , but also denounced by his ideological adversaries , he became and still remains a legend for his ideological companions , including the founders of this Association . Although his work is yet to be evaluated , it is undisputable that under his leadership ORG became an example of the human spirit ’s love of freedom . Thus , he placed an obligation on future generations to complete the holy liberation .

PERSON headed the Movement for an extremely long period ( DATE ) . He remained and worked as an intellectual and moral pillar of the revolutionary and cultural struggle of the NORP from GPE . This allows us to state that his publications are the most authentic and most reliable evidence of the ideological content of ORG . Due to their factual reliability they remain as historical evidence of unquestionable scientific value . His written legacy provides the present and coming generations with the most concrete evidence of the revolutionary and cultural struggle of the NORP from GPE . Of this legacy , the most important [ work ] is his CARDINAL - volume “ Memoirs ” , which are a national treasure of unchangeable value in the recent history of GPE . ”
b. The ORG aims to :
- raise and affirm the NORP cultural space , having as its priority the cultural and historical identity of the NORP from GPE who have appeared as NORP throughout DATE ;
- establish traditional ethic and human values ;
- affirm the ideas of ORG .
c. The ORG realises its objectives through :
- own book - publishing activity , publication of its own newspaper and its own electronic media ;
- the organisation of conferences , seminars and forums with outstanding scientific and cultural scholars from the country and abroad ;
- cooperation with scientific , cultural and educational institutions , and with similar associations and organisations from the country or abroad . ”

CARDINAL . After the opening speech by the Chairman of the ORG and a solemn performance of the anthem of PERSON , CARDINAL young men threw smoke bombs inside the conference hall , which caused a temporary delay . Some of the participants started to beat and kick the young men . The latter managed to escape , but a retired journalist was injured . According to the DATE newspaper “ PERSON vesnik ” of DATE , he sustained a “ fracture of his left hand and blood on his face ” .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG convicted CARDINAL persons of causing grievous bodily injury and sentenced them to CARDINAL months’ imprisonment . It found that the perpetrators had pushed the journalist , who had sustained a fracture of the forearm . CARDINAL of the perpetrators was a member of the ORG .

CARDINAL . There was a strong media campaign before and after the launch of the ORG , condemning its foundation and functioning as contrary to the NORP national identity . The ORG was described as “ fascist ” and as rehabilitating “ terrorism and fascism , which were the basic characteristics of PERSON ’s collaborator PERSON ” ( excerpts from the newspapers “ PERSON vesnik ” , mentioned above , and “ Dnevnik ” from DATE ) .

CARDINAL . In or DATE CARDINAL practising lawyers from GPE , together with a political party and ORG from the Second World War filed petitions before ORG challenging the conformity of the ORG ’s Articles and ORG with LAW . They also challenged the lawfulness of the ORG court ’s decision to register the ORG .
CARDINAL . The petitioners , inter alia , stressed that :
“ ... the aims of the ORG are the infiltration of NORP linguistic elements into the NORP language and alphabet ... ”
CARDINAL . The petitioners noted that all the ORG ’s documents bore the flag of PERSON . They continued :

“ The ORG promotes ORG ( meaning PERSON ) ideology for a change in the national conscience of the NORP people in favour of another one , which destroys the NORP national texture and leads to the encouragement of and incitement to national hatred and intolerance . The ORG rehabilitates and legalises terrorism and fascism as crucial characteristics of the work of PERSON ’s collaborator PERSON , as an “ act of holy liberation ” and as a legacy that is left to someone to complete ... The NORP from GPE who appeared as NORP ( GPE ) throughout DATE ... are unknown in GPE . They do not exist as a nation , any nationality or legitimate entity whatsoever . There are only NORP in GPE , and there also might be NORP , NORP ... as affiliated to different people and nations . However , there are no “ NORP from NORP ” .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG sent the petitions for reply to the second applicant , as Chairman of the ORG . The ORG contested the ORG arguments as its ORG and ORG did not contain any elements that would incite to national , religious or racial hatred or intolerance or would advocate violent destruction of the constitutional order .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG declared the petition admissible . The court found , inter alia , that there existed :

“ well - founded doubts that the ORG ’s Articles and ORG were directed towards violent destruction of the constitutional order of GPE and incitement to national or religious hatred or intolerance , and that as such they are not in conformity with LAW .
CARDINAL . It further declared itself incompetent to judge the constitutionality of the registration decision of ORG , because it was not vested with jurisdiction to decide on such decisions .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG declared the ORG ’s Articles and ORG null and void , on the ground that they were directed towards violent destruction of the constitutional order and incitement to national or religious hatred or intolerance .
CARDINAL . ORG based its decision on the following reasoning :

“ According to PERSON teaching , NORP ethnicity never existed on this territory , but belonged to the NORP ( GPE ) from GPE and its recognition ( i.e. , that of NORP ethnicity ) was the biggest crime committed by the NORP headquarters during its existence . According to his teaching , the process of de - bulgarisation of GPE , which was violently carried out after the Second World War , was a [ form of ] slavery executed by the NORP - communist regime and such NORP - communist doctrine continued to be the official one of the ORG after it became independent in DATE .

In line with those arguments , the founders of the ORG “ Radko ” took the following as their main ORG objectives : ( CARDINAL ) to raise and affirm the NORP cultural space , having as a priority the cultural and historical identity of the NORP from GPE who have appeared as NORP throughout DATE ; ( CARDINAL ) to establish traditional ethic and human values ; ( CARDINAL ) not to forget the NORP ethnic origin of the NORP people , as that would mean a denunciation of its tradition and culture .

Affirmation of the ideas of ORG , according to the ORG , in fact means relief from “ Macedonianism ” , as a NORP - communist doctrine , and from the “ imagined NORP nation ” which was used as an open door for the accession of the whole of GPE to GPE .

Taking that into consideration , the court holds that the ORG and ORG Radko”- ORG are directed towards the violent destruction of the constitutional order of GPE and to incitement to national or religious hatred or intolerance , and finds that they are not in compliance with LAW . ”
CARDINAL . As regards freedom of association , ORG argued as follows :

“ ... the court has taken into consideration that ORG freedom and right to association and activity , as part of the corpus of human rights and freedoms , are among the fundamental values for the existence and development of democratic relations in the functioning of government in GPE , oriented towards its citizens and their rights , freedoms , interests and aspirations . They are also the basis for the accomplishment of the constitutional determination of GPE as a democratic state . This being so , the above freedom and right are explicitly guaranteed in LAW and CARDINAL of the LAW of GPE .
However , the court finds that the freedom and right to association , organisation and activity can not be taken to indicate approval for all objectives and the choice of means to attain them .

The principles and safeguards for exercising freedom of association and activity are explicitly determined in LAW , which bans the ORG and activities of associations of citizens which are directed towards the violent destruction of the constitutional order of the LOC and to incitement to national or religious hatred or intolerance . Furthermore , ORG CARDINAL , CARDINAL and DATE of the LAW protect the sovereignty and territorial integrity of the Republic . ”
CARDINAL . Applying these criteria to the present case , ORG held as follows :

“ The ORG and ORG , read in the light of the prohibitions set forth in LAW , must be interpreted as aims which directly and explicitly call for destruction of the constitutional order , i.e. they explicitly encourage an incitement to national hatred and intolerance , and as such they are to be treated as aims and activities that are objectively directed towards what is banned by LAW .

In this context , the court takes into consideration the LAW to LAW , which takes as a historical fact that GPE is constituted as a national state of the NORP people and that every activity directed towards denunciation of its identity is in fact directed towards the violent destruction of the constitutional order of the LOC and towards encouragement of or incitement to national or religious hatred or intolerance and towards denunciation of the free expression of its national affiliation .

Bearing this in mind , the court found that the ORG and ORG Radko”- ORG are directed towards the violent destruction of the state order ; hindrance of free expression of the national affiliation of the NORP people , i.e. negation of its identity and incitement to national or religious hatred or intolerance . ”
CARDINAL . On DATE the Constitutional Court ’s decision was published in the “ Official Gazette of GPE ” and became final and enforceable .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ex officio decided to terminate the activities of the ORG ( се утврдува престанок на работа на PERSON ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants appealed the latter decision . They complained that it had been given on the basis of ORG decision , which in their view had not been final , but that ORG holdings on their application should be awaited .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the appeal as ill - founded . It found that an association of citizens would cease to exist ipso jure when ORG had declared its ORG and ORG unconstitutional . As ORG decision had been published in ORG and had accordingly entered into force , ORG upheld the lower court ’s decision .
CARDINAL . The LAW to the LAW , as valid at the material time , read , inter alia :

“ ... the historical fact that GPE is established as a national state of the NORP people , in which full equality as citizens and permanent co - existence with the NORP people is provided for NORP , NORP , ORG , GPE and other nationalities living in GPE ... ”
CARDINAL . LAW of DATE replacing the Preamble , reads , inter alia , as follows :

“ The citizens of GPE , the NORP people , as well as citizens living within its borders who are part of the NORP people , the NORP people , the ORG people , the NORP people , the NORP people , the Bosniak people and others ... ”
CARDINAL . The relevant provisions of the LAW related to freedom of association and ORG read as follows :
Article CARDINAL
“ ORG are guaranteed freedom of association to exercise and protect their political , economic , social , cultural and other rights and convictions .
ORG may freely establish associations of citizens and political parties , join them or resign from them .

The programmes and activities of political parties and other associations of citizens may not be directed at the violent destruction of the constitutional order of the Republic , or at encouragement of or incitement to military aggression or ethnic , racial or religious hatred or intolerance .
Military or paramilitary associations which do not belong to ORG are prohibited . ”
Article CARDINAL
“ Every citizen may invoke protection of the freedoms and rights set forth in the LAW before the courts , including before ORG , in a procedure based upon the principles of priority and urgency .
Judicial protection of the legality of individual acts of the state administration , as well as of other institutions carrying out public mandates , is guaranteed .
A citizen has the right to be informed about human rights and fundamental freedoms and also actively to contribute , individually or jointly with others , to their promotion and protection .
LAW and CARDINAL
“ ORG :

- protects the freedoms and rights of the individual and citizen relating to freedom of conviction , conscience , thought and public expression of thought ; political association and activity ; and the prohibition of discrimination among citizens on the ground of sex , race , religion or national , social or political affiliation ;
- decides on the constitutionality of the programmes and statutes of political parties and associations of citizens ... ”
Article QUANTITY and CARDINAL

“ The Constitutional Court shall repeal or invalidate a collective agreement , other regulation or enactment , statute or programme of a political party or association , if it finds that they do not conform to the LAW or law .
The decisions of ORG are final and enforceable . ”
CARDINAL . The relevant provisions of ORG provide :
Article CARDINAL

“ ORG may freely associate in associations of citizens and may establish foundations in order to accomplish and protect their economic , social , cultural , scientific , professional , technical , humanitarian , educational , sports and other rights , interests and beliefs in conformity with the LAW and laws .
Associations of citizens and foundations shall be non - profit organisations . ”
Article CARDINAL
“ The ORG and activities of associations of citizens and foundations shall not be directed towards :
- the violent destruction of the constitutional order of the Republic ;
- encouragement of or incitement to military aggression ; and
- encouragement of national , racial or religious hatred or intolerance . ”
Article CARDINAL
“ An association of citizens shall cease to exist :
... if ORG decides that the ORG and the ORG are not in conformity with the LAW ...
The person authorised to represent the association of citizens shall be obliged to notify the first - instance court of the circumstances as described in paragraph CARDINAL within DATE .
The first - instance court shall determine the cessation of the association of citizens by adopting a decision in non - contentious proceedings . “
